'''Bill''' was [[Samwise Gamgee]]'s [[Ponies|pony]], named for its original owner [[Bill Ferny]].

==History==
Bill was owned by [[Bill Ferny]] in [[Bree]], mistreated, half-starved, and probably without a name. He was the only animal in Bree after Bill Ferny or his allies had opened the stables of ''[[The Prancing Pony]]'', loosing all the mounts.

The next day, Bill Ferny sold the pony to [[Frodo Baggins]] for twelve [[silver pennies]], which was more than three times its worth.<ref>{{FR|I11}}</ref> This sale proved fortunate for Bill, as [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam Gamgee]] dearly loved him and nursed him back to health.

Bill the Pony travelled with [[Strider (Aragorn)|Strider]] and the [[Hobbits]] through the leagues of [[Eriador]],<ref>{{FR|I12}}</ref> carrying Frodo at one point on their journey to [[Rivendell]].<ref>{{FR|II3}}</ref> He then accompanied the [[Fellowship of the Ring]], carrying their rations. Outside the [[Doors of Durin|West-gate of Moria]], Bill was released into the wild for his safety and encouraged to make his way back to [[Bree]].<ref>{{FR|II4}}</ref>

On the homeward journey of the hobbits, Sam was reunited with Bill the Pony at the ''Prancing Pony''.<ref>{{RK|VI7}}</ref>  When the hobbits reached the gate at the bridge across the [[Brandywine]], Bill Ferny threw the keys at [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and was kicked by Bill the Pony as he ran off into the night.<ref>{{RK|VI8}}</ref>  

Sam rode Bill when he accompanied [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] on his trip to the [[Grey Havens]].<ref>{{RK|VI9}}</ref>
